trans-unit.source: PID for poiCollections: Define a storage pid where to store records of type Point of Interest.
trans-unit.target: PID for poiCollections: Define a storage pid where to store records of type Point of Interest.

trans-unit.source: Category root UID: If you're working in an environments with a lot of categories defined, it may make sense to reduce the category tree within our Events2 Plugins to this root Category.
trans-unit.target: Category root UID: If you're working in an environments with a lot of categories defined, it may make sense to reduce the category tree within our Events2 Plugins to this root Category.

trans-unit.source: x months in past: When creating a new recurring event this extension can create related day records for the last x months.
trans-unit.target: x months in past: When creating a new recurring event this extension can create related day records for the last x months.

trans-unit.source: x months in future: When creating a new recurring event this extension can create related day records for the next x months.
trans-unit.target: x months in future: When creating a new recurring event this extension can create related day records for the next x months.

trans-unit.source: Default country: If you're only working for one specified country while creating/editing POIs in backend it would be cool to set a country by default. So you only need to add street and city to find a POI. If you need POIs from all over the world, please keep this field empty
trans-unit.target: Default country: If you're only working for one specified country while creating/editing POIs in backend it would be cool to set a country by default. So you only need to add street and city to find a POI. If you need POIs from all over the world, please keep this field empty

trans-unit.source: XML Import Validator Path (xsd): While Importing Events we will check the XML file against a XSD file. If you need some specials you can define your own file here.
trans-unit.target: XML Import Validator Path (xsd): While Importing Events we will check the XML file against a XSD file. If you need some specials you can define your own file here.

trans-unit.source: Is organizer required: By default it is not needed to explicit set an organizer. But, if you want, you can set organizers as a required property with activating this checkbox
trans-unit.target: Is organizer required: By default it is not needed to explicit set an organizer. But, if you want, you can set organizers as a required property with activating this checkbox

trans-unit.source: Is location required: By default it is not needed to explicit set a location. But, if you want, you can set location as a required property with activating this checkbox
trans-unit.target: Is location required: By default it is not needed to explicit set a location. But, if you want, you can set location as a required property with activating this checkbox

trans-unit.source: Is category required: By default it is not needed to explicit set a category. But, if you want, you can set catgeory as a required property with activating this checkbox
trans-unit.target: Is category required: By default it is not needed to explicit set a category. But, if you want, you can set catgeory as a required property with activating this checkbox

trans-unit.source: Path Segment type: Set path segment type for frontend created events and PathSegment UpdateWizard. Set to "Do nothing" to keep path_segment untouched. Set to "RealUrl" to add a counter on duplicates (swimm, swimm-1, swimm-2). Set to "UID" to build a path segment based on title and uid.
trans-unit.target: Path Segment type: Set path segment type for frontend created events and PathSegment UpdateWizard. Set to "Do nothing" to keep path_segment untouched. Set to "RealUrl" to add a counter on duplicates (swimm, swimm-1, swimm-2). Set to "UID" to build a path segment based on title and uid.

trans-unit.source: email from address: The senders email address. If not given the extension tries to get one from INSTALL_TOOL.
trans-unit.target: email from address: The senders email address. If not given the extension tries to get one from INSTALL_TOOL.

trans-unit.source: email from name: The senders email name. If not given the extension tries to get one from INSTALL_TOOL.
trans-unit.target: email from name: The senders email name. If not given the extension tries to get one from INSTALL_TOOL.

trans-unit.source: email to address: The recipients email address.
trans-unit.target: email to address: The recipients email address.

trans-unit.source: email to name: The recipients email name.
trans-unit.target: email to name: The recipients email name.
